tidbits.title: Arctic Wilderness
tidbits.description: Svalbard, an Arctic archipelago, is known for its vast wilderness, glaciers, and unique wildlife like polar bears, while Jan Mayen is a remote volcanic island.

tidbits.title: Polar Night and Midnight Sun
tidbits.description: These regions experience extreme light variations, with polar nights lasting for weeks in winter and the midnight sun shining for continuous days in summer.

tidbits.title: Limited Human Population
tidbits.description: Svalbard has settlements, but strict regulations exist to preserve the environment. Jan Mayen has a Norwegian weather station, with few residents.
